etymologies: early 17th century: from Latin mater ‘mother’, on the false analogy of patriarch

definitions: a woman who is the head of a family or tribe

examples.text: in some cultures the mother proceeds to the status of a matriarch

shortDefinitions: woman who is head of family or tribe

definitions: an older woman who is powerful within a family or organization
shortDefinitions: older woman who is powerful within family or organization
